content: what was Pepsi thinking? Making a great ad about people from all walks of live joining in together in a protest, Pepsi binding them together even with the people who control the crowd. Yes, all beautiful people. Yes, they don’t really appear to be angry or even protesting. Yes, it shows America shallowness as a caricature. So maybe it was just f*cking brilliant and intended this way. True inception. We all unite because of a Pepsi ad. How could it be better? Does that answer your question?
